result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel R Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel R Peterson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daniel R Peterson was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: PAY DIRECT TO CLERK OF COURTS, ANY BOND POSTED MAY BE APPLIED
Concurrent with: any sentence currently serving.
Submit a DNA sample.  May not vote until civil rights restored.  Finds eligible for SAP or CIP.

Court - finds knowing & voluntary waivers of appearance & prelim - binds over

Def - enters plea of Guilty to Ct 1, waives rights & JT
Parties stip facts support the plea

Court - finds knowing & voluntary waiver and plea, finds factual basis & approves stip
Accepts plea & finds deft guilty of Ct 1

    Submit a DNA sample, may not possess any firearm, finds eligible for SAP or CIP

Cts 2 & 3 dismissed
Plea hearing on October 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
